Hello

My name is Kostis Gourgoulias and I am a PhD candidate in (Applied) Mathematics at UMass Amherst, advised by Professors Markos Katsoulakis and Luc Rey-Bellet. I'm also affiliated with GRiD (Graduate Researchers in Data) group and an assistant organizer for the Western Mass Data Science, Stats, and R meetup group .

To learn more about what I have been up to, feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn.

Research Interests

My research interests lie in applied mathematics, probabilistic modeling, and statistics. I am particularly interested in problems that are interdisciplinary and combine computations and mathematical thought.

As part of my thesis work, I developed theory and computational tools, inspired from information theory, statistical physics, and Bayesian statistics, to quantify uncertainties in probabilistic models and to assist with picking appropriate numerical schemes for long-time simulations.

Contact

My email address is kgourgoulias at gmail.com

Publications

  • Information metrics for long-time errors in splitting schemes for stochastic dynamics and parallel KMC, with Markos A. Katsoulakis and Luc Rey-Bellet. Accepted at SISC (2016). [arXiv]
  • Information criteria for quantifying loss of reversibility in parallelized KMC, with Markos A. Katsoulakis and Luc Rey-Bellet. Accepted at the Journal of Computational Physics (2016). [arXiv]
  • Information-theoretical bounds for uncertainty quantification, with Markos A. Katsoulakis, Luc Rey-Bellet and Jie Wang. In preparation.
